course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Advancing Global Health Equity
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: We will apply community-based primary health care methods to advance more equitable solutions for a maternal-newborn global health challenges. Teams will measure the disparity and look "back" to identify causes before looking "forward" to propose more equitable solutions for future change. Prerequisite: HLTH 250 "Foundations of Global Health".
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to four hours.
sections: Class Nbr: 5971, Section #: 9, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: J. Cranmer, Status: Open
